title: Cruel Intentions is coming to TV
text:
Email a friend 
CRUEL Intentions could be coming to television. 
NBC has ordered a pilot script for a follow-up series based on the cult 1999 film starring Ryan Phillippe, Reese Witherspoon and Sarah Michelle Gellar, Deadline reports. 
The film’s original writer-director Roger Kumble, as well as producer Neal H. Moritz are both said to be on board for the small screen adaptation. 
Lindsey Rosin and Jordan Ross, the duo behind The Unauthorized Musical Parody of Cruel Intentions , are also involved. The musical was a huge success in Los Angeles., with 38 sold-out performances. 
The drama series would reportedly be set in present day San Francisco, telling the story of 16-year-old Bash Casey — the son of Sebastian Valmont (Phillippe) and Annette Hargrove (Witherspoon). 
Bash moves from Kansas upon discovering his late father’s journal and learning of the family legacy he didn’t know existed. 
Cruel Intentions was a low budget, surprise box-office hit, bringing in more than $130 million worldwide. Phillippe and Witherspoon went on to marry in 1999. They divorced in 2008 and have two children together. 
The film was followed by two straight-to-video movies, Cruel Intentions 2 in 2000, starring Amy Adams, and Cruel Intentions 3 in 2004, starring Kristina Anapau. Ryan Phillippe, Reese Witherspoon, Sarah Michelle Gellar and Selma Blair in Cruel Intentions. Source: Supplied
